qas.question: What percentage of Hyderabad's employed are employed informally?
In 2007 how many street vendors did Hyderabad have?
What percentage of the street vendors in Hyderabad were male in 2007?
Of the street vendors in Hyderabad what percentage owned their own stall in 2007?
In 2007 what percentage of street vendors in Hyderabad borrowed money to finance their operations?

context: Like the rest of India, Hyderabad has a large informal economy that employs <a0_0>30%<a0_0/> of the labour force.:71 According to a survey published in 2007, it had <a1_0>40–50,000<a1_0/> street vendors, and their numbers were increasing.:9 Among the street vendors, <a2_0>84%<a2_0/> are male and 16% female,:12 and <a3_0>four fifths<a3_0/> are "stationary vendors" operating from a fixed pitch, often with their own stall.:15–16 Most are financed through personal savings; only <a4_0>8%<a4_0/> borrow from moneylenders.:19 Vendor earnings vary from ₹50 (74¢ US) to ₹800 (US$12) per day.:25 Other unorganised economic sectors include dairy, poultry farming, brick manufacturing, casual labour and domestic help. Those involved in the informal economy constitute a major portion of urban poor.:71
